description.narrative: (Uganda): .The Regional Health Integration to Enhance Services activity in East Central Uganda (RHITES-EC) supports 382 maternal, neonatal and child health (MNCH) sites and 115 TB management units in 12 districts. RHITES-EC supports implementation of a district-based integrated package of quality Maternal and Child Health, Family Planning, Malaria, HIV/AIDS, TB, nutrition, and WASH interventions in targeted districts. Three priority areas are: scaling-up and strengthening implementation of the high impact evidence-based packages; strengthening community-level interventions to increase demand and uptake of services; and strengthening health systems to improve delivery of services. Major activities include: strengthening healthcare service providers' skills through on-the-job training and mentorship; promoting evidence-based decision-making at district, facility and community level; leveraging other health and non-health platforms to increase coverage of services and diversify audiences particularly among young people and women groups; strengthening supply chain management at facility level to ensure sustainable commodity security; supporting district and local governments to ensure more effective stewardship, coordination and management of health service delivery; and improving quality of care. RHITES-EC will: support communities to identify and address structural, social and patient-related barriers to seeking health care; engage key stakeholders including religious and cultural leaders to create a supportive and enabling environment for quality health care services and better health-seeking behaviors within the targeted populations; and strengthen host country self-reliance through its district-based approach and meaningful engagement of all stakeholders and beneficiaries. These two approaches will building the capacity of communities to identify, plan, finance (where possible) and implement their own local solutions to their health challenges.. . .

title.narrative: Regional Health Integration to Enhance Services in East Central Uganda (RHITES-EC)
